title: Dez Squeeze is a Heavyweight Display with knockout punch and Resonant Voice.
content:
[Dezcom Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/squeeze/) is happy to announce the release of its first commercial typeface and plans several more releases in the near future.

**Dez Squeeze Fat** is a full-figured display face. It is generous enough in weight and width to make you a knockout! Heads will turn from ho-hum to hard-hitting with this face. Don’t apologize for your size—the ample look will speak volumes to your audience.

When you don't want to speak softly, Squeeze can shout above the crowd. Say it loudly and proudly, this face does not have a weight problem.  
The Dez Squeeze Family was developed as a clean OpenType display face with a super-bold weight  
Dez Squeeze has 483 glyphs with uppercase, lowercase, proportional lining figures, unicase, stylistic sets, alternates, ordinals, and case specific punctuation. It has a full range of diacritics and covers all European languages using the Latin script.

[http://dezcom.com/typefaces/squeeze/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/squeeze/ "http://dezcom.com/typefaces/squeeze/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KO-kid_550_5795.jpg)

ChrisL
author: dezcom

comments.content: Finally it's here! Congrats and good luck, Chris! I'm looking forward to seeing the other weights, too.

You are welcome, Mili! Thanks for all of your encouragement over the past few years!

I hope that you are about to flood the market with more awesomeness like this.

Yeah! Way to go! Congrats on your first release!
Congratulations, you've definitely started with a bang! Looking forward to more releases from Dezcom already.

Hope you do well, your work deserves it.  
:)

Thanks, everyone!

I would like to thank all the Typophiles who helped me along the way and prodded me into FINALLY pushing something out! This is truly a fine community.

Great work there, Chris!  
Now I just have to get one of my projects ready for release.

H.

Hello, Franz,  
The text you quoted is just placeholder text that I should have already replaced :-)  
Placeholder text is used just as a "temporary" filler in a Lorum ipsum sort of way. Now that my site is live, I will have to finish writing everything and replace it.

I assume the typeface you are talking about is "Dez Squeeze". It is a very heavy weight and wide display face with quite narrow counters. It is intended for use in large size display situations where you want high impact and a very dark color. For now, only the widest width has been released but there will be 4 narrower widths to follow shortly.

Thank you for your interest,

ChrisL

PS: Here is a sample of the 2 extreme widths:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DezSqueeze2width_5824.png)

Finally! Four years later, I have released the whole family with numerous added glyphs to the 7 widths.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dezcom/dez-squeeze-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dezcom/dez-squeeze-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dezcom/dez-squeeze-pro/")

Dez Squeeze Pro is a display family in seven bold widths. Choose the width that fits the space available for your headline. Dez Squeeze Pro is a very bold display face with multiple language support, nearly 600 glyphs, stylistic sets, Unicase, and many alternates. Dez Squeeze Pro is Bold enough for knock-out photographs, so go ahead, knock yourself out.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414031556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DezSqueezePlease-Poster_3699.png)
Gorgeous, congrats!
